intro: Campanula trachelium f. alba, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in gardens and naturalized areas.
